Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student may draw something resembling a fish shape but lack details.
The student might place the fish shape somewhere in or above wavy lines that could represent water (basic representation of aquatic environment).
CANNOT: The student may not label the drawing accurately, if at all, or use incorrect labels (e.g., calling water 'food').
The student might not include any other elements of the habitat such as plants or rocks (lack of understanding of complex habitat).
The student could misunderstand the relationship between the fish and water by drawing the fish above the water line (fish needs water to swim).
The student is likely unable to depict or label interactions between different parts of the environment (misunderstands connections within the habitat).
